trigger: AM580 , a stable benzoic derivative of retinoic acid , has powerful and selective cyto-differentiating effects on acute promyelocytic leukemia cells .

trigger: We show here that AM580 , a stable retinobenzoic derivative originally synthesized as a <extra_id_0> RAR alpha <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> agonist , is a powerful inducer of granulocytic maturation in NB4 , an APL - derived cell line , and in freshly isolated APL blasts .

We show here that AM580 , a stable retinobenzoic derivative originally synthesized as a RAR alpha agonist , is a powerful inducer of granulocytic maturation in NB4 , an APL - derived cell line , and in freshly isolated APL blasts .

After treatment of APL cells with AM580 either alone or in combination with <extra_id_0> granulocyte colony-stimulating factor <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ( <extra_id_0> G-CSF <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ) , the compound induces granulocytic maturation , as assessed by determination of the levels of <extra_id_0> leukocyte alkaline phosphatase <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , <extra_id_0> CD11b <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , <extra_id_0> CD33 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , and <extra_id_0> G-CSF receptor <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> mRNA , at concentrations that are 10 - to 100-fold lower than those of ATRA necessary to produce similar effects .

After treatment of APL cells with AM580 either alone or in combination with granulocyte colony-stimulating factor ( G-CSF ) , the compound induces granulocytic maturation , as assessed by determination of the levels of leukocyte alkaline phosphatase , CD11b , CD33 , and G-CSF receptor mRNA , at concentrations that are 10 - to 100-fold lower than those of ATRA necessary to produce similar effects .

By contrast , AM580 is not effective as ATRA in modulating the expression of these differentiation markers in the HL-60 cell line and in freshly isolated granulocytes obtained from the peripheral blood of chronic myelogenous leukemia patients during the stable phase of the disease .
